description.content: Dice that are added to Success Rolls. For each +DICE, add one die to the pool of the 2D6 roll. Roll all dice and pick the two highest. If the Keyword applies to a Weapon, the dice are only added to Success Rolls for attacks made with it. +DICE and -DICE cancel each other out in pairs before rolling.

Dice that are added to Success Rolls. For each -DICE, add one die to the pool of the 2D6 roll. Roll all dice and pick the two lowest. If the Keyword applies to a Weapon, the dice are only added to Success Rolls for attacks made with it. +DICE and -DICE cancel each other out in pairs before rolling.

Dice that are added to Injury Rolls. These work like +DICE and -DICE but apply to Injury Rolls instead of Success Rolls. +INJURY DICE means you add extra dice and pick the two highest; -INJURY DICE means you add extra dice and pick the two lowest. If the Keyword applies to a Weapon, the dice are only added to Injury Rolls for attacks made with it.

Modifiers that are applied to the result of an Injury Roll after the dice are totalled. If the Keyword applies to a Weapon, the modifier is only added to Injury Rolls for attacks made with it. The maximum cumulative -INJURY MODIFIER is -3.
An activity a model can carry out when it is Activated. Common ACTIONS include Move, Dash, Shoot and Fight. Each type of ACTION can only be performed once per Activation unless stated otherwise.

If a model has a piece of Battlekit with this Keyword, it will use it in the next game that it takes part in. When the model is deployed, say which Ranged Weapon the Battlekit will be used for. It gains the (KEYWORD) until the end of the game. The Ranged Weapon you choose cannot already have the BLAST, FIRE, GAS, or SHRAPNEL Keywords, and cannot have more than one type of AMMUNITION.

A Weapon with this Keyword reduces the target's total -INJURY MODIFIER from its Armour Characteristic, and/or any Armour or Shields it has by 1, to a minimum of 0. For example, if a target had Standard Armour and a Trench Shield, the -INJURY MODIFIER would be lowered from -2 to -1.
This model is not of natural biological origin but is instead constructed from non-organic elements. ARTIFICIAL is a Tag with no inherent Effect — other rules may reference it.
Ranged Attacks made with Weapons that have this Keyword do not prevent a model from taking a Charge or Fight ACTION during the same Activation.

When you take a Shoot ACTION and choose a Weapon with this Keyword to make a Ranged Attack, you can make a number of Ranged Attacks with this Weapon equal to X, one after another. The attacks can target different enemy models if desired, as long as they are all within 6" of each other. Resolve each attack one at a time. Any BLOOD MARKERS or BLESSING MARKERS that are spent only modify the Injury Roll for the Ranged Attack they are spent on.
This model is part of the Cult of the Black Grail Faction.

A Ranged Weapon with BLAST (X") has a blast radius in inches equal to X (including vertically). The target can be an enemy model or a visible point on the battlefield within Line of Sight and range. On a Failure, the attack misses unless the weapon has the SCATTER Keyword. On a Success or Critical Success, every model with Line of Sight to the target and within the blast radius is hit. Friendly models within 1" of a hit enemy are also hit. If you roll a Critical Success, only add the extra INJURY DICE to the roll for the original target.
When you deploy a model with this Keyword for the first time in a game, place a number of BLESSING MARKERS beside the model equal to X.

The model is under the influence of a supernatural or chemical enhancement that provides temporary benefits. Each marker can be spent as +1 DICE to a Success Roll, or as -1 INJURY DICE to an Injury Roll made against this model. A maximum of 6 BLESSING MARKERS can be on a model at any time.
Add -1 DICE for Melee Attacks targeting a model with this Keyword, or that has a Weapon that has this Keyword, if the attacker made a Charge ACTION before making the attack this Turn.

BLOOD MARKERS are placed on models that suffer an injury. Each can be spent by either player — as -1 DICE to the wounded model's Success Rolls, or as +1 INJURY DICE when rolling Injury Rolls against the model. A maximum of 6 BLOOD MARKERS can be on a model at any time.
BLOODBATH:

subcontent.content: You can spend 6 BLOOD MARKERS from a model (or 3 if the target is Down) to convert the Injury Roll into a Bloodbath Roll. Roll 3D6 and add all three dice together. +INJURY DICE and -INJURY DICE are added normally, but you pick the 3 highest or lowest instead of 2. With the DEADLY keyword, Bloodbath Rolls use 4D6.

description.content: When you take a Fight ACTION and choose a Weapon with this Keyword to make a Melee Attack, you can make a number of Melee Attacks with this Weapon equal to X, one after another. The attacks can target different enemy models if desired. Resolve each attack one at a time. Any BLOOD MARKERS or BLESSING MARKERS that are spent only modify the Injury Roll for the Melee Attack they are spent on.
In a campaign, Battlekit with this Keyword is lost at the end of a game in which it is used.

A model with this Keyword has the Cover or Defended Obstacle attack modifiers. Cover applies -1 DICE to Ranged Attacks targeting the model. Defended Obstacle applies -1 INJURY MODIFIER to Melee Attacks targeting the model when the obstacle is between attacker and defender.
Add +2 INJURY DICE instead of +1 INJURY DICE when a Critical Success is rolled for an attack made by a Weapon with this Keyword.
Weapons with this Keyword require two hands to use, even if the model has the STRONG Keyword. However, they can still be used alongside a Shield with the Shield Combo stipulation.

If you Activate a model that is in terrain with this Keyword, or if you move a model into terrain with this Keyword during a move, you must take a Risky Success Roll. On a Success or Critical Success, carry on with the move (no more rolls needed for this Keyword this move). On a Failure, make an Injury Roll for the model and its Activation ends. Sometimes DANGEROUS TERRAIN will have Keywords in brackets (e.g. DANGEROUS TERRAIN (FIRE)) — any Injury Rolls caused have those Keywords.

When you make an Injury Roll for an attack made with a weapon with this Keyword, roll 3D6 and add all 3 dice together. Any +INJURY DICE or -INJURY DICE are added to the roll normally, except that you pick the 3 highest or lowest dice in the roll instead of the 2 highest or lowest.
A model with this Keyword has the NEGATE FIRE Keyword.
Battlekit that is represented by a model or terrain piece that can be set up during the game.
Every 1" a model is moved across terrain with this Keyword counts as 2".
The most senior and heroic models in a Warband. They have different rules for experience and advancement in campaigns, and often enjoy a different weapon, armour and equipment selection.
Add -1 DICE to a Melee Attack that targets a model with this Keyword. Models that cause FEAR are immune to FEAR themselves.
After making the Injury Roll for a Weapon with this Keyword, place 1 extra BLOOD MARKER next to the target model even if the result is No Effect.

A model with this Keyword is part of a group of 2 models, both of which must have the FIRETEAM Keyword. You can Activate friendly models in the same Fireteam simultaneously, taking their ACTIONS in any order and switching between them freely. However, if the Activation of either member ends during a simultaneous Activation, it immediately ends for the other model too. A model cannot be in more than 1 Fireteam.

When a Weapon with this Keyword is used to make a Ranged Attack it is automatically a Success. Do not make a Success Roll for the attack. Note that this means that the attack cannot achieve a Critical Success.

When you make a move, retreat move or charge move with a model with this Keyword, you can measure the path on which it travels 'through the air'. It must end the move on the battlefield or on a terrain piece. You must still take a Risky Success Roll for DANGEROUS TERRAIN, and it cannot end its move on IMPASSABLE TERRAIN. Do not make an Injury Roll if a model with this Keyword Falls.
After making the Injury Roll for a Weapon with this Keyword, place 1 extra BLOOD MARKER next to the target model even if the result is No Effect.

Goetic Powers and Spells are marked with the keyword GOETIC (X) where X indicates how many BLOOD MARKERS must be spent to trigger the effect. These BLOOD MARKERS can be taken from any model currently on the battlefield, friendly or enemy, but must come from models that do not have the DEMONIC or BLACK GRAIL Keywords. BLOOD MARKERS used this way are removed from the game. Each Goetic power can be used only once per Activation.

A model with this Keyword treats an Out of Action result from the Injury Roll Table as a Down result unless the result was caused by a Bloodbath Roll. You cannot remove BLOOD MARKERS from a friendly model with this Keyword (the opposing player can use them normally). A model with this Keyword has the NEGATE FEAR and NEGATE GAS Keywords, but cannot have the TOUGH Keyword.

Grenade-type weapons ignore penalties for cover and long range. They do not count towards the number of Ranged weapons a model can carry and do not have to be held in your hand at all times. A model armed with grenades can use them as many times as they wish.
A model may only wear one piece of Headgear at a time.

A model cannot be equipped with more than one piece of Battlekit with this Keyword and it does not receive a Charge Bonus when it makes a charge move. In addition, if a Ranged Weapon or Grenade has this Keyword, you cannot use the Weapon or Grenade to make a Ranged Attack and take a Move, Charge, Retreat, or Dash ACTION with the attacking model as part of the same Activation.

A piece of Battlekit with this Keyword requires one hand to carry and cannot be put down. Because of this, a model that has this Keyword can only be equipped with or use either a 1-Handed Weapon or a Shield. It cannot be equipped with or use any 2-Handed Weapons, or both a Weapon and a Shield (even if the Shield has the Shield Combo rule). It may still carry Grenades.
This model is a member of the Heretic Legions Faction.
Ignore -INJURY DICE and -INJURY MODIFIERS for a target's Armour Characteristic, and for any Armour or Shield pieces of Battlekit that it has, for attacks that have this Keyword.

Ignore the Success Roll or Injury Roll modifier that is specified. For example, the Success Roll for an attack made with a Ranged Weapon that had the IGNORE COVER Keyword would not be affected by the -1 DICE modifier for a target that is in Cover.
Models cannot be moved onto or across terrain with this Keyword.

The ARMOUR PIERCING and IGNORE ARMOUR Effects do not affect any -INJURY DICE and -INJURY MODIFIERS that apply to Battlekit that has this Keyword. Any other Battlekit the target model has is affected normally.

The model is under the influence of a supernatural or chemical malady that provides temporary effects. Each can be spent as if it were a BLOOD MARKER. If a model has at least one Infection Marker when activated, it gains +1 Infection Marker.

When a model with this Keyword is deployed for the first time in a game, it can be set up anywhere on the battlefield as long as it is out of the Line of Sight of all enemies and is at least 8" away from the closest enemy. INFILTRATORS are deployed after models that do not have this Keyword. Any INFILTRATORS that cannot be deployed in this way are instead deployed normally in their deployment zone.
Add +1 DICE to Morale Checks if your Warband has at least 1 model with this Keyword on the battlefield that is not Down or Out of Action.
You can only purchase as many of this piece of Battlekit as indicated by the number in parenthesis for your Warband. If you find more via looting/exploration, you can break this limit.

When a model moves into contact with a Marker or terrain piece with the MINED Keyword, the mine will detonate unless the model has the NEGATE MINED Keyword. Make an Injury Roll with the SHRAPNEL Keyword for the model that detonated the mine, and then the Marker or terrain piece loses the MINED Keyword. If the model that detonated the mine wasn't taken Down or Out of Action, it can then continue its move. Models with the FLYING Keyword only detonate a mine if they finish a move in contact with it.
A model with the NEGATE Keyword is not affected by the specified Keyword's Effect. For example, a model with NEGATE SHRAPNEL ignores the Effect of the SHRAPNEL Keyword.
This model is part of the Principality of New Antioch Faction.
This model is part of the Trench Pilgrim Faction.

A pistol can be used as a Melee Weapon or a Ranged Weapon, and can be used as both in the same Activation. When it is used as a Ranged Weapon it has the Range shown on its Profile and uses the attacking model's Ranged Characteristic. When used as a Melee Weapon it can use the attacking model's Ranged or Melee Characteristic and can be used as an Off-Hand Weapon if desired.
When you Activate a model with this Keyword, before carrying out any ACTIONS, you can remove up to X BLOOD MARKERS from the model.
If a model makes an attack with a Weapon that has this Keyword then its Activation ends after the ACTION that allowed the attack is completed.

If you must make a Success Roll for a model that is using a piece of Battlekit that has this Keyword, then the Success Roll becomes a Risky Success Roll (the model's Activation or ACTION will end if the Risky Success Roll is a Failure). This Effect is ignored if the Success Roll is already a Risky Success Roll.
If you fail your Success Roll when taking this ACTION, the Activation of this model ends immediately.

Some Weapons with the BLAST Keyword also have the SCATTER Keyword. If the Success Roll for the attack was a Failure, the attack scatters instead of missing. Subtract the Success Roll from 7 to get the scatter distance in inches. Your opponent moves the attack that many inches in a direction of their choice (must have Line of Sight to the original target). Then determine hits as described in the BLAST rules.
Add -1 INJURY DICE to rolls for attacks made at Long Range with a Weapon that has this Keyword instead of the usual Long Range modifier (-1 DICE).
After making the Injury Roll for a Weapon with this Keyword, place 1 extra BLOOD MARKER next to the target model even if the result is No Effect.

If an enemy selects a model with this Keyword as the target of a Charge, you can choose to evade with your model before the Charge is made, as long as your model is not within 1" of an enemy. When a model evades, roll a D3 and move the model that many inches. It must finish this move more than 1" away from all enemy models. If this move results in there being an interposing model between the evading model and the charger, the charging model must choose the interposing model as its charge target.
Enemy ranged attacks suffer -1 DICE against this target.
A model with this Keyword has the NEGATE HEAVY Keyword. In addition, it can equip and use one 2-Handed Melee Weapon as if it were a 1-Handed Melee Weapon.
This model is part of the Sultanate of the Iron Wall Faction.
This model is part of The Court of the Seven-Headed Serpent Faction.
The first time a model with this Keyword suffers an Out of Action result on the Injury Table, it is treated as a Down result instead.
